r9IYOCbQML1eeMRWRz77Fg.text: Best spicey food in London - really worth trying their specials ! Love the chana chaat

erV-YZceQdBuEkpbX1-0ww.text: The food was very nice and I would give it 4 stars.  Unfortunately our party accepted a table downstairs which lacks atmosphere though has the advantage of being very close to the Gentlemen's.  In addition, the waiter was seemingly uninterested in his work and not very attentive.

vWH-KE1k4o9Ku1MDNM33Lg.text: Walking the street 9/12/12, rainy evening in London. Lone diner. I was advised to go here by one of the staff at the hotel. I am glad I did. As I was peering into the window, deciding if I should, the owner came out and insisted I come in (even though a party of 1). The food was excellent The specialty of the house is a lamb dish which was so tender. I could not finish it and was flying back to NY the next day. they packed it well for me and I brought it home. My son ate it the next day and said it was some of the best Indian food he ever had.

hT-QaV6Vh3eTmmP8zGYTcQ.text: Visiting American tourist meets penultimate Indian meal. Results in life-changing experience, one that will be recalled just before the state administers my lethal injection, 'cause I'm not going down without a fight, coppers.

3c0k_g-AgH_lyqjhvFxvHQ.text: Came here on new years eve. Absolutely wonderful little place. Food was fresh and tasty. Staff were efficient and fast. Setting was lovely and traditional. Will definitely go again.

rDoOhrAA4_2fLeHiNfo8wQ.text: Very nice Indian food.  Excellent service.  Papdi Chaat was nice with pomegranate seeds.  Lamb chops were tasty

xBz_pZgI6a4Mpzxk4n2Fsg.text: Walked in by chance as I was looking for somewhere to have lunch and loved it! Thought I was going to regret it as I was the only customer in the restaurant but not at all. Everything taste fresh and good, spices just the right level resulting in very fine food! Any time again!

9xd0joE5TqRCxo9tJYlP1A.text: What a fantastic experience. I would definitely return here. The food was great, both traditional and surprisingly fresh and new. Top off the great food with excellent sevice and you get a top notch experience. Definitely deserves it's Trip Advisor rating.

7hMBhw89ximfdxDlaERNWg.text: Amazing place!!!! Came here for a romantic dinner after a long day of touristy attractions. This was really close to our hotel and we just walked maybe 5 or 10 min. I had the Chicken Tikka Masala that blew my mind it was mildly spicy so it was perfect and the rice was for sure my favorite! It was the perfect end to a long day! Would love to come back here soon! Dont pass this place up!

IHDR-qMf9UImbrKfmFS9PA.text: Eat here! You won't regret it. Zayna is rated one of the top restaurants in all of London. It was pure luck that it was located near our hotel and that there wasn't a wait for a table when we arrived! Inside was very cozy with comfortable furniture and mood lighting. The service was attentive and professional although a bit slow toward the end.After reading over their mouth-watering offerings I settled on Murgh Taka Tuk (marinated chicken with onions, tomatoes, chillies, and coriander). My vegetarian boyfriend and his vegetarian mom each ordered two half portions from the vegetarian menu. In short, it was all amazing, from the presentation right down to the food itself. I was particularly lucky because I got to sample the vegetarian dishes as well. Needless to say, we ate every last bite and were quite stuffed after. The three of us shared Falooda for dessert, but I found noodles on ice cream to be a little strange both in taste and texture.It's on the pricey side, but you get what you pay for. And it is London after all! Overall, I'm really glad we got the opportunity to eat here. It is certainly one of the best Indian restaurants I've been to.

TuixAqA4sV0IuEIlOSi8fg.text: Very expensive for Indian food.  Portions were small.The grilled lamb was delicious.

JlTs6mTpUK4ZkEBdATXDEw.text: Wonderful neighborhood restaurant.  Only a few tables in a small room, but simple, aromatic flavors fill the air. Chaat and Murghs were all delicious.  Open late on Friday night.

f1HyNM4ZUTmDombYYuy7Pw.text: The food here was AMAZING! Just don't try to be a hero and order it spicy-- you'll have steam coming out of your ears!

fMtdtTndWduZVWp-InhfqQ.text: My mother and I are huge fans of Indian food, but we wanted to try something slightly different. Walking to work every day, my mother saw signs outside Zayna's door touting the awards this Pakistani restaurant had won. We were intrigued.We ordered our standard Indian food favourites: lots of naan bread, aloo ghobi, Bhindi (okra) curry, and tandoori salmon. As an experiment, we also ordered a chick pea appetizer that came with yogurt sauce and pomegranate seeds. The food was really tasty (if a touch oily), and we couldn't help but finish our meal with a bowl of temple-achingly sweet house-made ice cream. The food was delish, and the staff was really quite lovely, lighting tea lights on our table before gingerly placing our food on them. That's a nice detail I've never seen before. The staff was generally attentive and helpful, our experience only slightly mired by our server's comment to my mother as we left: "goodbye, Lady!" Perhaps not.

sgoaQFg-k6zT7JleuWiQlA.text: This is our second time at Zayna and we were not disappointed. My husband and I love Indian food, and this is some of the best we've had anywhere. The restaurant is easy to reach by tube, it does take reservations and while it's a relatively small space the noise level is not a problem and it is conducive for a pleasant conversation while eating the deliciously prepared plates. The prices seem right and we will certainly go back for #3.

LM9PS9XIrGR4uRfhYwF4MA.text: This indian/paki restaurant is fantastic... I enjoyed a glass of red wine, a plate of lamb saag, and a cup of tea... Of which the host recommended the lamb saag which is special at the zayna restaurant... I will go there and try another dish next time.

qeklI4uHhntqheSwitoxWQ.text: My wife and I had one of the finest dinners either of us have had in our lives at Zayna. the service was excellent and exact with nothing left to be desired. we were seated promptly and waited on by several staff members. I had the mukhun murgh with naan and was so very impressed. The location is central and the restaurant itself was well-designed. I would make a special trip back to London just to eat at this place again. yes, it was that much of an enjoyable experience!

NbzckgZUfYc_cN4Y94EOHg.text: The food was ok. I wouldn't complain about it, but wouldn't say it's great either (tip for San Francisco folks: if you eaten at Amber or Dosa, just skip this one. It's not worth your time). What was awful though is the service. The person who was taking care of us was just rude for no reason and it totally spoiled our dinner. I would've enjoyed staring at the wall in my hotel room more.

R0Yf6UCWDQdaCjYUIYt-NA.text: Very nice setting, great food and super service. Not the cheapest but good value for money.

GTXZOcbR524jWLR6P_nE9A.text: Great food here. Its different front other indian/Pakistani food with its own style. Food was five star and service was 3.5 stars.

nXikv_fr3tZ8JYDnbI1zcw.text: Absolutely exceptional food. The mango lassi is just superb along with the lamb biryani.

mUjKC9HFXBNmPJVl-hjmTg.text: Great food but quite expensive. The music on our visit was some kind of Euro technic rubbish and pretty much ruined the dining experience for us. Noisy and profane businessmen at next table.

dRRuKmcJmYDN3xLPrGAvDg.text: Although not among the cheapest indian restauratnts it offer good value for money. Nice service and good indian food.

SdpDhUbEG4THDXtiiiRTYg.text: Elegant Setting, Attentive Service, Great FoodOur January 2011 dinner at Zayna on New Quebec Street provided an elegant setting, warm friendly service, and extremely good Indian/Pak food.  Zayna, recommended to us by the Hyatt concierge, looks like an average restaurant a block or two away from the Marble Arch on Oxford Street, but when you climb the two steps (Note: not wheelchair accessible, but accessible if you are ambulatory with assistance) to enter the restaurant, you see a small but elegantly decorated restaurant with beautiful carved wooden panels on the walls.  Zayna has basement seating, but it may be less romantic than the main level.  The servers were extremely attentive.  The waiter taking our order knew the menu and ensured we did not order too much food.  The servers diligently but unobtrusively kept our drinks filled and verified all was fine throughout the meal, as well as deftly served our platters, which were sizzling hot.  The food was amazing, by far better than Monsoon on Brick Lane and even better than UK's oldest Northern Indian Restaurant Punjab on Neal Street, London.  We had nicely spiced pakoras for £4, the potato stuffed naan for for £4, the fantastic still sizzling mixed grill (2 lamb chops; chicken and lamb kebabs; and 2 types of spicy ground meat kebabs) for £19, and the intensely flavored lamb curry called Baati Ghosht for £16.50.

ScHV5yqLaR5_spoikSQLzA.text: Excellent food.  Had the lamb chops, two vegetarian dishes and paratha.  Gulab jamun was excellent as well.  Ambiance is just fine.

-ZD2QAiYKR91ktopiGo5XQ.text: Excellent restaurant.  I made a reservation there based on ratings on TripAdvisor, which ranked this the best Indian/Pakistani restaurant in London and number 10 over all.We were not disappointed.  The shammi kabab and reshmi kebab were flavorful.  The Safed Murgh Korma (not to be confused with chicken korma...the sauce in this is white) a Mughal specialty from North India rarely found in any restaurant was superb.  The Paneer Makhni was good as were the Naan. The desert choices are small and my gujrayla was ok but my girlfriend's Gulab Jamun (served with ice cream) was spectacular.What a wonderful find...we are definitely going there again on our next trip to London!

JVrdCMhYyBdHnkWE3ghxzw.text: We made reservations at Zayna based on the reviews of the food and the nice ambiance of the restaurant. When we got there, on time, at 8PM on a Wednesday, we were led through the vibrant, colorful dining room (which was full) and downstairs into a small, cramped room that was completely devoid of character. White tile floors, cheap tables and chairs, no ambiance whatsoever. There was only one server for several tables in this basement room, and he was enthusiastic but seemed inexperienced and overworked, so the service was spotty at best. The food was generally very good, though our server insisted we get the Mukhun Murgh (their rendition of chicken tikka masala). We did, and it was quite mediocre, easily the worst item we ordered. The Murgh Taka Tuk and the grilled paneer, on the other hand, were outstanding. We also ordered the Kastoori Tikka, Malai Boti, and Shahi Palak, all of which were very good. However, this quality of Indian food can be found in many, many lower-end places in London, at far lower cost. What makes Zayna worth paying the extra for is the elegance of the environment. If you sit upstairs, you get that. But if they take you to their basement, you are basically eating in a dive joint that has less ambiance than most hole-in-the-wall Indian restaurants in London. If you go here, be sure not to let them take you to their basement.

7dQyRV12fN-sZWUbxhXXLg.text: Zayna has amazing food with a lot of really interesting north Indian and Pakistani dishes you don't normally find in London. Both the meat and vegetarian options were great and nothing like the usual substandard fare in your neighborhood Indian restaurant. It was expensive (~£105 for 2 people with wine) but soooo worth it. Definitely book as it gets quite crowded. The atmosphere is a bit bland but the food is phenomenal.

4QJQUmUTuAO_sCkmp5kg6Q.text: Great curries.  The lamb dishes are the way to go.  We sampled a few dishes and all were excellent.  We can't get Indian food like this where I live.  Are here twice while in London.  Tiny restaurant so make a reservation.

viJG3eVIJ-A3PtACKFEC0g.text: The minute I land in London, it never fails, I crave for Indian food and this is the perfect place for it.  My friend from work suggested Zayna, so off we go this quaint yet cozy place.  Naturally, I start out with my favorite, some Samosas, it was flaky and tasty followed by the chicken tikka masala, a bit on the spicy side, but oh so good.  The one that stood out were the Prawns, it transported me back to my childhood because it tasted alot like my grandmother's recipe.Although, nothing beats the indian food at Asha's in Dubai, I think I'll make Zayna my new favorite when I'm in London.

4j72Vr32ISb4WAejohQJOQ.text: Long wait decent food but overpriced for the quality. The cost for the 4 of us was 120 pounds I would expect better food and service for those prices. There were 2 groups who were seated after us and they both ate before us. Nice environment if my bill was 30 percent lower and service 40 percent faster id give it five stars.

MyOJmrrGcpKD5FexFtolRA.text: On a whirlwind trip to London, we just had to fit in an Indian meal to our crazy itinerary. Top rated Amaya doesn't allow children (apparently even foodie tweeners who are globe trotters) , so BOO. We decided to try Zayna. Wow. Fantastic meal. The Batti Gosht was spicy and lemony in all the right ways. The lamb pieces were juicy and tender. We also ate the Makhun Murgh. Perfect. You can always tell the quality of an Indian restaurant by their naan. What can I say--fluffy, tasty, hot, fresh. We arrived late... Minutes before last orders but never felt rushed. Hard working and earnest owner was a plus.

FeUvcMgtfgdNbLrt3qs2WA.text: Every single dish here was phenomenal - and we had about 10 of them between the three of us. Most of them packed a pretty good punch in terms of spiciness, but not too much. Was my favorite meal of my weeklong trip

SW_LHcqgIaPfRY3xjGVOlg.text: Totally delicious.Very unassuming from the street, but don't walk by. Not really sure what we ordered, we just told our waiter to choose for us.  3 starters, 4 mains (2 chicken 2 lamb), spinach paneer (outstanding).  Starters were Papdi Chanaa chaat-  this is so unusual and very good.  Spicy and sweet.  Samosas, and the Jumbo Prawns (lived up to their name)Mains, can't even imagine what they were, but there was not a bad one in the bunch.  All had sauces, not that it helps.  Go in and enjoy!

QLGcHmWVX_YKpkEDcy8Akg.text: Amazing meal and amazing service! This experience will be tough to beat. We ordered the Papdi Chanaa Chaat, Dal Makhani, Ishtu, and Garlic Naan. Food and flavors were delicious...the Papdi Chanaa Chaat was so simple yet so good. The prices are very fair and the staff is very friendly and attentive. We had a great conversation with the manager and owner during our meal. If we lived in London this would be our favorite neighborhood place!

U4RFuBJhpUlQ8I-lqulzbg.text: Really good restaurant, and location, although the setting doesn't compare with the magnificence of nearby La Porte des Indes.Service is OK, although a bit messy at times.The food was really good, and with the excellent spinach and Paneer curry, you'll wonder why we even bother eating meat at all !Will go again, for sure !

o2P8SKIvE1cgnHMdFLdJcA.text: I was in the city on business from the states. I found Zayna on yelp and couldn't have been more pleased. The restaurant is beautifully put together, and the staff welcoming and helpful. And as for the food; let's just say they get it. I tried the Papdi Chanaa Chaat at the server's recommendation and you could taste each component, and the pomegranate added a lovely bit of tart, and the crisps some great texture. Had the Baati ghosht, the lamb was so moist, no fat, and the spices mixed perfectly, a little spice and nothing overwhelmed. Am heading back next time I'm in town.

iPtmGOqQuAi8MfiAHBlmgQ.text: We arrived @10pm (late) had to order quickly, luckily everything we ordered was delicious!  Very friendly service.  Order their specialties, you won't regret it.

cwwggl5TOdmFGtrlZohAHA.text: Food was great. Service was ok. Overall experience was good. Would go again. Expect to smell like the kitchen when you leave. If you enjoy your meal, that's a good thing.

DsZ1GA_Wjem2jiYlAWZ7hg.text: First visit and I will return. Food was fantastic with an excellent blend of flavors. The service was very good.

qrT9TSZV8yLqdissgXwdMg.text: I would come back to London just for this restaurant and I practically did. This was my second or third time here and I love the food and service! This was where I fell in love with Indian cuisine. The naan, lamb and vegetable dishes are all great and I love their mango salad! Our waiter was also very nice and helped us order our food. Love this place!

v-TSpTNZKTs6wC4Tx9-piQ.text: Great Indian and fantastic service.  The mango lassi was very smooth and a great way to start the meal. had three dishes: Mukhun Murgh, Jheenga Baati and the Beef Karahi.  All dishes were cooked perfectly and the owner engaged in healthy conversation with the guests throughout the meal.  Well worth visiting if you're in the area looking for a great meal and prompt service.

so5SGFpjmg2O1oV-wWhEFw.text: we thoroughly enjoyed this place. the food is exquisite, staff is friendly, excellent wine list and a very nice atmosphere. we enjoyed every single bite and our bottle of wine. try their mango salad with passion fruit. i just about died and went to heaven. they also have a great variety of starters. you could almost order a bunch of those (tapa style) and call it a meal.  but why... when all the entrees are amazing! a place i'll definitely return to the next time i'm in london!

photos.caption: Photo of Zayna - London, United Kingdom. Their mango salad with passion fruit dressing is out of this world!!!
Photo of Zayna - London, United Kingdom. Bread pudding with cardamon ice cream and caramel sauce

xvQm7HMz97Z6dL4MxD8EUw.text: Oh man this place was AMAZING!!!  The food, the service, the ambiance of the restaurant all working together to make such an incredible dining expereince.  One of my friends with us had never had Indian food before and I was both jealous and sad for him because he got such an awesome intro to Indian food but now his standard is going to be so high that when he eats Indian food elsewhere it will most likely be a disappointment. lol.This place came highly recommended by our hotel concierge and now by me, dining here is a must.

3KB6xRmXlDd5yDmJqfmCTw.text: I am upgrading food here to 5 stars. After eating in a few high end Indian restaurants in London this week, Zaina is a standout

2BO6q1e4U7ksLJGKAyh75A.text: Best Indian food of my life. The manager was amazingly attentive and patient with us while we decided on entrees. We ordered Tandoori Jheenga, Mukhun Murgh, and Shahi Palak with chicken. Every item was extremely delicious in it's own way. Desert was quite tasty and the food came out pretty quickly. Overall amazing food that I would highly recommend.

7l2tZhAvibN0EAgW1DQP0A.text: A jewel of a place. Tiny inside but very friendly I had the samosas, some kind of green chicken that was succulent and the recommended lamb gosh plate all of which was fantastic. I think the lamb portion is meant for two but it was so good I ate the whole thing. The garlic naan was excellent, very buttery and tasty and went well with the lamb dish. At the end of the meal the server accidentally spilled splashed a bit of water on me. He felt bad about it so he gave me their handmade pistachio/cashew ice cream. Don't leave without trying that, way yum.

KzNCHw98DXqXZoCeWiJFIg.text: Excellent service, and the food was amazing! We had a chicken tikki masala-like dish and a 1/2 spinach and 1/2 mixed veg dish -- everything was delicious. Not greasy, just spicy enough, very flavorful. Would go back again in an instant.

GdXxn-z35l5ZKhdTFNXw8A.text: I'll start by saying the food was delicious. Flavorful and various options with Pakistani influence. However, for the portions, they were more expensive than they should have been. I'll blame the Churchill area for the high price. When asked for water, the only options given we're either still or sparkling. Bad on my part for assuming we'd just get tap; I got a bottle of still water. No warning that it would cost extra unless I specified tap. So one star down for that. The staff was friendly, though one in particular was "too friendly" to my female dining partner. Was awkward to say the least. Also a mention to any and all staff, never call a woman brassy, broad, cheeky nor hard to please.  Minus two more stars. Overall, the food alone was good and though I'm traveling the city, if I was staying longer, I doubt I'll revisit. Of you plan on going, be sure to bring your credit card, your first born to cover the bill, and removing your emotion chip to avoid the uncomfortable feeling of an overly flirty server.

G6WUCHgrAteJXALxoUNlDA.text: Underwhelming and rather empty at 6pm on a Monday.  Came in for dinner alone, and only one other couple in the front of the restaurant and the chef in the back working on his Mac.  The food was ok, but nothing breathtaking (had the til mil jheenga - two fried shrimp with a rather basic hot sauce; mukhun murgh - their version of chicken tikka masala, naan and basmati rice).Try something else if you want extraordinary.

photos.caption: Photo of Zayna - London, United Kingdom. Garlic naan
Photo of Zayna - London, United Kingdom. Mukhun Murgh and Basmati rice
Photo of Zayna - London, United Kingdom. Til Mil Jheenga

T1mxy_-l3G4JvmEghkiYDg.text: We were seated in the basement next to the restroom. At first I did not mind because we were so hungry. But I got irritated when the server kept forcing us to order more food. We ordered 2 entrees & 1 appetizer & our bill was about £100. I don't mind paying more if the food is good & the portion is big but this place is a rip off. The food was not even that good & the portion is very small. There are better and more reasonable restaurants than this one. I will never go back to this restaurant again.

WcSktH0pnAmcYGVFoR9HZQ.text: The food was delicious and the setting lovely. The servings could be slightly more generous. Service was just attentive enough without breathing down our necks. I would go again.

HrBqGDPBEQRS60idKoWF4w.text: Good Pakistani restaurant near Marble Arch. Meat and vegetarian menu available.Tried with a group of friends, the service was good and they suggested us very well! We share a lot of different meats and other plates. Very nice atmosphere, medium prices

GCqijD6_VvOE5nFMHvRsyQ.text: The service and food were very good. The garlic naan were tasty.Thank you to the manager for seating us the last second.

kPLI5c2xX-mtJHFU5dfVTA.text: My wife and I made reservations for 8:00 PM on a Sunday night, and we arrived promptly after a full day touring Windsor Castle, City of Bath, and Stonehenge...so we were a bit famished. We chose this restaurant mainly for its close proximity to our hotel...and after consulting Trip Advisor.The restaurant didn't seem to have any empty seats (it is not a big place but there seemed to be additional tables downstairs close to the wash rooms) when we got there, aside from our reserved table. We were seated immediately and shown the menu. I opted for Ishtu (the house specialty), and my wife chose Murgh Chatkhara, accompanied by garlic naan and white basmati rice.The main dishes were all good and flavorful...the naan was just OK. While the food garnered high marks as well as the attentive service, I don't feel the value is there. In a city replete with Indian (or Pakistani) restaurants, I felt there are other restaurants with food just as good as Zayna for a fraction of what you would pay in this restaurant.

WDcx-d5i_42YsjhNyLu5WQ.text: I don't know much about Northern Indian and Pakistani food, but on the strength of this sample, that is all about to change! Fantastic flavours, some new, some just the highest class of things I've had before. We sincerely enjoyed every minute of our meal.

91v7nJsuK_pCy_rR0HzP2w.text: So so good! It was so good we went back twice.  The first night, they were closing so we had to order quickly but the prawns in the tomato based sauce was so good we had to go back again.  The servers were friendly and kept up with drinks and water.  The food was so delicious that I wish it was in the States so I could go again.  I felt that the prices were pretty reasonable because the portions were generous.  A little out of the way but seems very popular since the tables seemed packed even late at night.  I also liked that it was open on Sunday whereas many restaurants in London seemed to be closed.We had the prawns (the best) as well as the lentils and the Chana.  All were good.  The garlic naan had a good amount of garlic on it and the rice portion was generous.

J1lgiz9GDEAn9ELZKQeG6A.text: This place was fantastic! The setting was beautiful and intimate. We started with samosas and a fried shrimp dish. For our entrees, we ordered the mix grill (lamb and chicken), lamb saag, naan and basmati rice. Everything was the delicious and the staff was friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Zayna - London, United Kingdom. Beautiful decor
Photo of Zayna - London, United Kingdom. Samosas and a fried shrimp dish. Yummy!
Photo of Zayna - London, United Kingdom. Mixed grill

MuLBMzW1bkaZt7q2m5Ap-Q.text: Small restaurant, yummy food and great service.  Although a bit pricey

KJYlUgXiwCdaGkTytNUi-Q.text: Delicious!!! Thank you Yelp for sending me here. A must visit. The service was great. Clean, fresh food. Well done

photos.caption: Photo of Zayna - London, United Kingdom. Inside the resturant. I think the food is fantastic!

6KC0xEjyErTTduhEqJKGBA.text: On a recent trip to London, we had dinner at the charming Zayna restaurant in Mayfair where we'd been once before. They serve Northern Indian and Pakistani specialties in a lovely, cosy space filled with sumptuous fabrics and carved wooden furniture.For starters, we had vegetarian samosas, a delicious mélange of sautéed potatoes and peas encased in delicately flaky pastry. We also tried their "Boti" (chunks of yogurt marinated grilled chicken) which was superb.For our mains, we split an order of the Chicken Murgh Masala which consisted of chicken bathed in an outstanding creamy tomato gravy as well as the Salmon Sultani, grilled salmon cooked in an aromatic blend of crushed tomatoes, ginger and pepper.The waitstaff were friendly, polite and attentive. While Zayna's food is more expensive than your average London curry house, the food is topnotch and the atmosphere is delightful!

uZJ12OZn8sQNcouatPw9zA.text: Really nice, and oh so flavorful we came for lunch and it was empty. From reviews is assume dinner is more popular. The lamb is the way to go.

pw0enngh6hWPIYAGj9jAfw.text: Wow! I have eaten in many Indian restos in London and in India, this is one of the best, maybe the best i have had in London. From the fresh, light, sweet mango & pomegranate salad to the tangy, perfectly spiced Baati Ghost (lamb stew) and the flavorful, again perfectly spiced Aloo Ghobi (cauliflower) and slightly crisp, but still very good garlic naan, all was presented well and, most importantly, tasted like a dream! Topped it all off with a Bread pudding thingy with cardamom vanilla ice cream. Cardamom has been my fave dessert spice for a long time and goes in my eggnog, hot chocolate, rum drinks, you name it. Zayna has made it on the go-to list for London Indian food cravings, which happens often thankfully!

8SJ7vShK-YRXxPXDVl9s6A.text: Wonderful and amazing dinning experience.I've had  Pakistani and North Indian Cuisine from San Francisco to New York City and this tops them all... absolutely WONDERFUL, from the delicious amazing food, outstanding wine list to the superior service,  I highly recommend this place. First off I love Pakistani -  Northern Indian Food, the spices, the flavors, Zayna hits the ball out of the ball park. Just the right amount of hot and spicy where you can enjoy the flavors of your wonderful meal.I had the following, all were amazingly delicious!!! 5 stars! (from the grill) Kastoori Tikka  (YUMMM)(from the pan) Baati Ghosht  (YUMMM)(on the side) Chickpeas rice with pilau and garlic naanDessert - Falooda Staff was attentive, helpful and friendly!Can't wait to go back!

hMhpG4OZPPnTlgn5bwuoCw.text: Very close to my hotel so I made my way there with a friend one night for dinner.  Very good Indian food.   Good, but not excellent - maybe missing a little something but I'm not sure what.Service was okay, maybe a bit awkward.  A few items were brought to table warm instead of hot.  I need hot food people!!Ambiance is very casual and the prices just don't match the ambiance.Would return for lunch and/or order on the cheap side.

KhV98klwU15GIsf5HFUnEQ.text: A great Indian/Pakistani option for people staying at the Leonard or Zetter hotels.  The is solid Indian fare.  We ordered aloo gobhi, baigan ka bharta (a spicy personal favorite), ishtu (lamb),  mukhun murgh, and garlic nan.  All were tasty, but the GBP100 bill for 4 people felt a bit hefty for 4 Indian dishes, 2 teas, 2 orders of nan, and no alcohol.  We were there for a bit less than 2 hours and toward the end we felt like we were being escorted out, so they could clear the table.  All and all, a good experience, but if I want to pay a lot of money for great Indian food, I'd likely go to Trishna.  If I would prefer to pay less, I'd choose Dishoom. If I happened to be around Marble Arch, I'd go back here.

tCapXlLCRBiM7a9cdiSGug.text: Good service but the food is only okay. It's not your typical London Indian fare. The restaurant is full of tourists.

LznLDxFFy0Mqr7GzhmKrmw.text: Great meal here upon arriving in London. We were late and they were kind enough to accomodate us without a reservation despite being busy.  We enjoyed the meal very much and especially the curries, all of which were really well made. Nothing too fancy or out of the ordinary, we mostly had the standards which were all well done. Very pleasant evening and good, solid Indian/Pakistani food in the Marylebone area.

y-2lTZdxRFr7IhNcDSbAcA.text: A great combination of professional and efficient service and perfect Indian dishes. I had the lamb in yogurt dish that was just fantastic !  Didn't want to leave the place.... the manager  was very present in the restaurants. He made sure everything was as good as it can get. Finished with a great Falooda ice cream. A real treat !

0jM0xJDRf0022PV8OqF3ZA.text: Someone should tell the concierge at the Arch London that a request for Indian food does not mean Pakistani food.In any event Zanya impressed us mostly as a hustle, and certainly not worth anywhere near the price we paid for dinner.

P3zvDzujRLqLf_8duLDV1Q.text: American reviewer here.  I've been to London many times, and was very lucky to stumble across Zayna on my first trip.  My wife and I enjoyed it so much, it was the only restaurant we ate at more than once on that trip.  And we've been back every time we've been to London since.It's some of the best Indian food I've ever had, maybe the best.  I wish I could remember precisely which dishes we've ordered over the years, but we've had a number and all have been very tasty.  The milder dishes (butter chicken style) are subtle and delicious.  The hotter currys manage to hit a perfect mix of fragrant spice and flavor, and also lots of heat (without being too much).  The meat is well cooked.  I would highly recommend to any travelers.  Next time I'm in London I'll be back.  This is a very strong 4-star (bordering on 5 star) restaurant.

4hVcjA4zYeu0JNUbbh1tBA.text: There is limited seating so be sure to make reservations. We've eaten at this restaurant about ten times in the last two years. When making reservations, request upstairs seating. This is not a great restaurant to bring small children or babies. The kutchoomer salad is a great way to start. It is comprised of diced apples, onions, cucumbers, lemon juice and parsley. It is so refreshing. The chicken skewer is spicy but comes with a dipping sauce that calms it down. Mukhun murgh is our favorite dish that is basically cooked white meat chicken cut into chucks and simmered in a rich curry sauce. We also order garlic naan bread and pileu rice. We've tried the lamb and beef and the chicken is the best.

photos.caption: Photo of Zayna - London, United Kingdom

MWp_8zU9ch8Mux6M3HarBg.text: Excellent dinner. North Indian and Pakistani menu. Nice wine list and the service was good.  I would have given five stars but its pricey. I will definitely come back.

vmsFbLIJYFeHi9LagH_qDA.text: This place always delights me and my business guests. Service is top notch and food is incredible. Amazing naan, chicken and lamb. Can accommodate gluten free and vegan so you can indulge yourself while keeping your healthy eating habits in check. A must if you enjoy this type of cuisine! We shared many plates, including paneer, rice, lentils. Everything was delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Zayna - London, United Kingdom

a_IK_BKR8v1HLlFyYsQEsg.text: Great food, very steep price! We were in the area so we thought might as well stop by since it was a Pakistani restaurant. I definitely felt underdressed, given most people were wearing formal shirts and pants. The owner however was very kind and let us sit down and offered us water and drinks immediately. The menu isn't overwhelming; it has just the right number of options. We ordered the Shahjahan Biryani, the Mixed Grill, Bengan Bartha (Eggplant) and a dish called Chicken Shaalimar. Each dish was between £14-18 and naan and accompaniments were another £5-7. Food quality was great, portion sizes were very very small for the price. This is definitely for more upscale audiences. As we were heading out, the owner, also from Pakistan and who relocated in London, struck up a conversation with my folks and we all talked for a good 25-30 minutes. It was refreshing to see just how caring and kind he was to us all.

Mze8Dwma0z_dXxhe1Kw2cg.text: Delightful, up-scale Pakistani restaurant.  Best dishes we had were the butter chicken, the lamb curry, chicken biryiani, and the seekh kabab.  (Those are not the names on the menu, but you can order them by these names.  The actual names on the menu were unfamiliar to me.)  The dishes were balanced in flavor, appropriately salted, and bore the kick that one expects in Pakistani cuisine.  They do have one chicken kabab dish for kids that is flavorful without being the least bit spicy -- perfect for our small ones who are not (or not yet -- hope springs eternal) fans of the chili pepper.The second time we dined here, we were seated in the smaller room in the basement because they were so busy in the main dining room.  In most respects, the room downstairs is less desirable than the main dining room. There is just one exception -- the basement location provides a view of the kitchen, through a large, decorative window.  We were able to watch the four chefs at their respective stations -- prepping veggies, forming kebabs from scratch, rolling bread, tending the tandoor, spicing the dishes free-hand and from memory.  We enjoyed the food all the more having watched the chefs perform their art.They can get busy, so if you're going at a popular time (like weekend dinner), it's probably a good idea to call ahead and make a reservation.

iQGeGGhmlc3knTcH2n16Mw.text: Excellent Indian food!  Great venue and very friendly service!  I would highly recommend: especially the mixed grill!  Awesome place!

photos.caption: Photo of Zayna - London, United Kingdom. Paalaak paner! Yummy
Photo of Zayna - London, United Kingdom. The mixed grill

He_YX1myfvvvLQss2PACpg.text: Incredible tastes of Pakistan with an excellent ambiance and possibly some of the world's best service!We were 4, two locals, and LA transplant and myself. We shares plates and ordered grilled tandoori shrimp, a spicy curried chicken cooked in a yogurt sauce, mixed spinach vegetables and lamb meatballs. All of this came with roti and rice along with chutney.The flavors are incredible! I saw the Michelan emblem on entering and knew we were in for a special treat. These guys exceeded expectations and the service was wonderful. I definitely recommend and am already looking forward to my next trip!!!

4ukmrV9yn3qxAy4DbnduRQ.text: Lovely restaurant with tasty food. Try the lamb chops! The paneer was excellent as well - something for everyone and a very nice staff and atmosphere.

WHwjrbzdZypK1_y__0R3IA.text: We're from Vancouver.  Visiting london and heard indian was must try. This place didn't disappoint. We went for their famous Tiki Masala and two veggie dishes (mixed lentil and spinach). Decent service (needs improvement), really nice ambience and likely the best indian cuisine I've ever tasted.  Loved the experience. Highly recommend

photos.caption: Photo of Zayna - London, United Kingdom. Delicious!!!

kOspwODukZA1HOerPNMuPA.text: This was a fantastic traditional Indian Restaurant. Before coming to London everyone told me they had the best Indian food in London. This place stands up to that reputation. We went in without a reservation however they accommodated us with dinner until their reservation arrived. Great service, everyone was nice. We tried a few new dishes to us which was yummy. At the end topped off with their homemade pistachio honey ice cream. Wow!

wPgzhwYloegys3vsnqN_EA.text: Retuned to London again in May and revisited Zayac 2 times....still consistently great food...keep it up!

aRFEtbiId0dYk7embniDJA.text: We specifically went here to eat their "falooda". The service at this restaurant is just horrible!!! We were a party of six, one of my friends was carrying a water bottle which she was about to put away in her bag and the hostess very rudely said that outside drinks are not allowed!! Then we sat for about 10 mins and no one attended....no drinks....nothing! We were handed the menus and we asked for dessert menu. The server laughed at us and said that people usually have dinner first and then dessert, so we said that we were unusual and would like to see the dessert menu. Sat for another 15 mins.... no one offered any drinks....no water either. Then another server came and said if we would like to place our order. We then asked for dessert menu again and he said that he would have to talk to the manager as that is not their practice! We asked to speak to the manager and he very flatly said that they were out of all desserts!!!Have traveled the world and eaten at best restaurants and hole in the wall places and so far no one had treated us in this manner! Very disappointed "Londoners"!!!

xpi1Il3sn1ixnV9X44cSuA.text: So tasty!We came here on a rainy Saturday for lunch, mostly due to proximity to our destination, but this could be a destination in itself. The server was opinionated about what was good and what wasn't (we did ask) and helped us select a fantastic combination of dishes.We weren't starving, so ordered two curries and one rice as we figured that would be enough. Took our first bites and immediately ordered some naan as well. Not due to hunger, but just because we knew we'd want to mop up every last drop of sauce we could.It's not cheap, but for us it was totally worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Zayna - London, United Kingdom. So well spiced

c0dMd-lGI5ik0uF4z4s2_w.text: We enjoyed our dinner at Zayna. We had Pakoras, Prawns  and Mango Salad as appetizers. Dinner consisted of Tandoori Salmon, Murgh Karahi and Baati (Balti) Lamb.Mango Salad was excellent. Prawns were good as well. Pakoras were over cooked and so was the Salmon. The curry bases were good but meat on both Karahi and Baati was over cooked and, therefore, a bit tough. Overall it was a good experience and I will give it another shot.

nGpGoEdk1X1naxb-4o4rVg.text: What a gem! Amazing service and food. The samosas were perfectly crisp and juicy. The butter chicken full of flavor and the garlic naan the best I've ever had. You can tell this restaurant puts pride in every dish. I will be back whenever I find myself in London.

cCVGRplt6tilZFXc48zhuw.text: Wonderful restaurant- clean and good service. Started with samosas that were delicious and not greasy. Ordered their house specialities that did not disappoint and delightful mango lassi. Upstairs is noisy, downstairs is quieter but less ambience.A bit expensive compared to nearby Indian restaurants.

fQR_ESyWdqeIwV22MeZAtA.text: Absolute horrible experience. I came to have dinner by myself. Apparently this is looked down on in this restaurant. They treated me like I was unworthy of a table upstairs with everyone else and acted like they were pulling strings to "figure things out". Next thing you know I'm being brought downstairs in a small area of basement seating by MYSELF. I told the waiter that I didn't want to sit down there by myself and that it was weird. He said he had to ask if they can do something else and to wait there. Ummm ok.... I decided it was crazy for me to stand there and went upstairs. The original host told me "madam I'm sorry we have nothing for you". A few tables were empty. I couldn't even respond to that and just walked out. Mind you, I was very presentable and respectable looking. I was simply a female dining by myself. Dispicable. Michelin behavior? I don't think so.
